info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 8:34PM CDT until March 29 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
info.description:
Gauge and Doppler Radar reports of 2-4" are noted near areas of ponding water on roadways that have occurred according to public reports. These areas inundated with excessive rainfall will continue to pose a hazard to those traveling leading into the over the next few hours this evening.
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in south central Louisiana, Lafayette and St. Martin. In southwest Louisiana, Vermilion.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Carencro, Broussard, Youngsville, Henderson, Maurice, Ridge, Cecilia, Indian Bayou, Parks and Milton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Lafayette, LA; St. Martin, LA; Vermilion, LA
